meanings.definition: Expressing a compliment; praising or approving.
meanings.sent1: She received a complimentary note on her excellent presentation.
meanings.sent2: The teacher gave a complimentary remark about the student's hard work.
meanings.sent3: The complimentary words from her friend made her smile.
meanings.sent4: His complimentary feedback was like a warm hug for her efforts.
meanings.sent5: The complimentary review boosted her confidence.

meanings.definition: Given or supplied free of charge.
meanings.sent1: The hotel offers complimentary breakfast to all guests.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the complimentary snacks provided on the flight.
meanings.sent3: The complimentary drinks at the party were a pleasant surprise.
meanings.sent4: The complimentary gift with purchase made her day.
meanings.sent5: The complimentary samples allowed her to try new products for free.

meanings.definition: Serving to complete or enhance something.
meanings.sent1: The dessert was served with a complimentary sauce.
meanings.sent2: The artwork on the walls was complimentary to the overall decor.
meanings.sent3: The complimentary colors in the painting created a harmonious blend.
meanings.sent4: The music played in the background was complimentary to the romantic atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The additional decorations were complimentary to the theme of the party.
